title: Who will be elected senator from North Dakota in the 2018 midterm elections?
preds:
Cramer with a steady lead, and consistently polling over 50%.
https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/nd/north_dakota_senate_cramer_vs_heitkamp-6485.html
All in on Cramer. Heitkamp never had a prayer anyway.

Will be a miracle to win again, repeating a shock win in a state Trumpy won in 2016. 
283 (7 today) from 116. 25-75-0 
Was 19-81-0 now 1-99-0
Bet#5

261 (1 today) from 111 29-71-0 
Oct3rd: 170 (6) from 88 @51-49-0
Bet#4 crowd is right most of the time correct? Not sure if the anti-Kav vote is as big a deal as claimed, but ND is a special kind of America. Can Heitkamp hold on or will Cramer flip it easily? ND is a red state, low-info FNC viewing small govt country peeps and doubt Heitkamp can campaign as well as McCaskell to pull the rabbit out of the hat. Or appeal to the base-instincts of MAGAkins like Cramer probably is. Scare them about Honduran immigrants despite ND being so far from Mexico and harder to get to (and earn income) than say east coast states.  So going 19-81-0 as voter suppression probably isn't as big an issue as coastal states, but could still have an affect, otherwise I'd just go all in to 99.  Is Koch money going to Cramer or not?
Heitkamp's could win if she can mitigate Republican voter suppression efforts.   It's an uphill climb.  But it is possible.
Heitkamp still has a relatively strong following despite her missteps
Heid’s vote on Kav speaks volumes to NoDaks!
Heitkamp may be the incumbent but she is falling further and further behind in polling in the state.
Increasing slightly Heitkamp's chances (8%) as I am trying not to be too swept up by her Supreme Court vote.
-1% dem from 538m for Kav effects in red state.
I'm not sure what on Earth happened, but RCP have got Cramer up 8.7% with the last 2 polls having him up 10% and 12%. I'm at a loss...

I think this is the hardest seat for Democrats to hold this cycle, and Cramer is well ahead in the polls.
https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/nd/north_dakota_senate_cramer_vs_heitkamp-6485.html
fixing earlier error, switched Dem and GOP. 538m
Deviating significantly from 538 due to her announced vote on Kavanaugh.

update from 538 has a 52% chance Heitkamp loses.
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2018-midterm-election-forecast/senate/ & Nate Silver tweeted this a few hours ago:
"Don't want to bury the lede, though, which is that North Dakota looks like a really difficult slog for Heitkamp and that makes the Dems' senate math very hard"
What's up with this 10 point lead by Cramer?
Heitcamp's chances down. The Kavanaugh hearings demonstrate to Republican voters just how precarious the Republican majority is, and the Supreme Court was one of the things that got Trump elected.

She's the incumbent and she's politically savvy, but N.Dakota is deep Trump territory and Cramer has established himself as a major Trump Cheerleader.
Could go either way...
State went overwhelmingly for Trump. Heitkamp is not a great campaigner. Nuff said.
Most of North Dakotan's care about the oil and natural gas and the livelihood they represent.   They might vote her out simply because Democrats do not support their needs in the short term.
Standing pat for now. The next poll, whenever that is released, may cause me to change my mind, but if the number of undecideds remains 10% or over, I would say Heitkamp will lose.

Going with incumbency and anti-trump sentiment on this one.  Farmers understand how much the President has hurt them.  A Senator in ND should be on a first name basis with almost everyone in the state.

If Fearless Leader Chucky will cut her loose to vote for Kavanaugh (or call in sick), she'll win safely if not big.  Otherwise it will be tough.   Fearless Leader Chucky has been pretty stupid for the most part, so stay tuned.
Update: based on pollsters predictions. Crowd: 47/53 (Cant remember how I came to my previous forecast of 20/80. Must keep better notes.)
Heidi is moving to the center and interviewing Kavanaugh next /this week. back to toss up.
Disenchantment with Republican Congress, strong Democratic candidate in a good year for women to win.
Stupid is as stupid does - Forrest Gump
Overall, the race ratings at ScottRasmussen.com show four races with Democratic senators that are currently considered toss-ups: Florida, Indiana, Missouri, and North Dakota.
Overall, the race ratings at ScottRasmussen.com show four races with Democratic senators that are currently considered toss-ups: Florida, Indiana, Missouri, and North Dakota.

In these polarizing times, I don't think deep red North Dakota will elect a democrat. Trump's support of Cramer is buoying and there is no equalizing force on the Democrats' side. However, it is still polling very close.
Heitkamp has raised all $11 million to Cramer's 3.2 million. Incumbent Senator's won 93% of reelection races in 2016. However, 63% of North Dakota voted for Donald Trump.

Tariffs hurt North Dakotans in many ways, especially from the direction of steel and agriculture.  Dearer oil, as a result of more expensive steel, will further alienate North Dakotans from the Republicans.  Many will simply not vote.  Whatever the reason, Cramer will lose because now even the Koch brothers can't work with Trump or any of his endorsed.

40-59-1 to 50-50-0 due to Koch billions aren't going to help a few GOP candidates. Will be a close race now. Kochs are even supporting a Democrat in another race, who'd a thunk it? Wild.  0.55 Cramer and 0,45 Heitkamp 46 from 32 bettors

Edging Heitkamp a little higher given the Koch brothers are not backing Cramer: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/daily-202/2018/07/31/daily-202-inside-the-koch-strategy-to-spurn-squishy-republicans-in-key-senate-races/5b5fc7221b326b0207955e64/?hpid=hp_hp-more-top-stories_trumpkoch-705am%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.aa4e0eb997b7.

Based on the last poll I know of that ended 6-15-18 the race was closely tied with Cramer up by 0.5%. But, now a Generic Ballot reflects the Dems have imroved over Repubs by a roughly 2 point advantage for a +9.2 total since then. https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/what-some-early-high-quality-polls-can-tell-us-about-the-race-for-the-house/ https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/nd/north_dakota_senate_cramer_vs_heitkamp-6485.html

Early polls suggest that support for Cramer has grown over time and he is now ahead. "Presidential tilt" helps Cramer. Voters know how important this result will be at the national level so they will likely revert to their partisan voting tendency which in this republican state again helps Cramer.

It's a hair's edge competition.  Republicans are pushing untold sums into the race.   Trump is popular within the Republican Party.  But, the agricultural states and North Dakota is an agricultural state are feeling the pain of Trump's trade wars. To her advantage, she is an incumbent.  It's a very tough call.

Real Clear Politics polling average has Heitkamp with 43.3 and Cramer with 44 as of June 15. 
https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/nd/north_dakota_senate_cramer_vs_heitkamp-6485.html Cramer recently criticized Trump's stand on Putin, said the POTUS was harder to defend than to explain. His camp is also said to be nervous about the effect tariffs will have on his state's farmers. 
But Trump won North Dakota by over 30 pts. and the GOP is focusing heavily on this race.
People are watching closely how Heitkamp will vote when it comes to the confirmation of Kavanaugh to SCOTUS.
Is Kevy related to Jim? Is he as dodgy? Booyaah!

Judge Kavanaugh's nomination puts Sen. Heitkamp in a bind: to get democrat donors and base supporters, she has to denounce Judge Kavanaugh as the worst human being ever, because he is nominated by Pres. Trump. But in a red state which voted for Mr. Trump, anti-Trump rhetoric only brings out GOP votes.  Most recent poll shows Mr. Cramer leads Sen. Heitkamp by 4 points (margin of error was 4), while 4 months ago,  he trailed by 3 points. This coincides with the rise of Mr. Trump's approval rating.
Cramer has a lead in the only recent poll and the state leans heavily republican. Still, Heitkamp is the incumbent and this is shaping up to be a democratic wave year.

This state will receive heavy attention from Trump and the voter base is one which will respond to that attention.
Some of the votes Heitkamp will have to make before the election will gave Cramer the opportunity to mark her as out of mainstream of average North Dakota voters.  I believe there will be above average turnouts this Fall around the country and that will result in Democrat and Republican candidates winning in a traditional way and reduce chances for upsets.  If so North Dakota will send the Republican to the Senate.
If the polling is even, the incumbent probably loses.
Like Manchin and Tester, Heitkamp has been showing deference to Trump and playing the state's middle (which the Coastal Dems see as Republican-lite).
I think if the polling is a draw, Trump's problems will finally come into play this fall.
